attributes.action: produce a Code of Conduct for Ministers that wins public confidence, laying out clearly and indisputably those areas of systemic, operational and policy failure in government departmental practice and administration which should trigger immediate ministerial resignation and thereby restore public confidence in government.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Governments of all persuasions have tried to lay out some general principles in a ministerial code of practice. However, recently (over the last two decades) there have been a number of occasions on which it has not been clear to the public why a minister of the Crown has not resigned for patent failings in his or her department. At a time when faith in the political process is failing, a clear statement on this is long overdue.
